content:
I'd be happy to dive deeper into my current morning routine.

After waking up at 7:30 am, I usually reach for my phone to check the time and then scroll through social media or my email notifications. I know it's not the best habit, but it's become a mindless routine for me. Sometimes I'll spend around 15-20 minutes scrolling through my feeds before I even get out of bed.

After that, I'll try to do a 10-15 minute morning meditation session, but it's been challenging lately. My mind is often preoccupied with thoughts about my project, and I find myself getting distracted or feeling anxious during the meditation session.

I don't really have a consistent morning routine beyond that. Sometimes I'll grab a quick breakfast, but I often rush out the door to get started on my project work.

I realize that my current morning routine isn't setting me up for success, and I'd like to make some changes to prioritize my well-being and energy levels. Do you have any suggestions for how I can improve my morning routine and create a more sustainable and energizing start to my day?
